1:
God, why have you rejected us forever?
\q Why does your anger burn against the sheep of your pasture?
\q
2:
Call to mind your people, whom you purchased in ancient times,
\q the tribe whom you have redeemed to be your own heritage,
\q and Mount Zion, where you live.
3:
Come look at the complete ruins,
\q all the damage that the enemy has done in the holy place.
\q
5:
They hacked away with axes
\q as in a thick forest.
\q
6:
They smashed and broke down all the engravings;
\q they broke them with axes and hammers.
7:
They set your sanctuary on fire;
\q they desecrated where you live, knocking it
to the ground.
\q
8:
They said in their hearts, "We will destroy them all."
\q They burned up all of your meeting places in the land.
9:
We do not see any more signs;
\q there is no prophet any more,
\q and no one among us knows how long this will last.
\q
10:
How long, God, will the enemy throw insults at you?
\q Will the enemy blaspheme your name forever?
\q
11:
Why do you hold back your hand, your right hand?
\q Take your right hand from your garment and destroy them.
12:
Yet God has been my king from ancient times,
\q bringing salvation on the earth.
\q
13:
You divided the sea by your strength;
\q you smashed the heads of the sea monsters in the waters.
15:
You broke open springs and streams;
\q you dried up flowing rivers.
17:
You have set all the borders of the earth;
\q you have made summer and winter.
18:
Call to mind how the enemy hurled insults at you, Yahweh,
\q and that a foolish people has blasphemed your name.
\q
19:
Do not hand over the life of your dove to a wild animal.
\q Do not forget the life of your oppressed people forever.
20:
Remember your covenant,
\q for the dark regions of the land are full of places of violence.
\q
21:
Do not let the oppressed be turned back in shame;
\q let the poor and oppressed praise your name.
23:
Do not forget the voice of your adversaries
\q or the uproar of those who continually defy you.
